metadata.title: Convert Kilopascals to PSI – Pressure Converter
metadata.description: Convert pressure from Kilopascals (kPa) to PSI (Pounds per Square Inch), useful for tire pressure and equipment specifications.

introduction: This converter transforms pressure measurements from Kilopascals to PSI, bridging metric and imperial pressure units.
Tire pressure and equipment ratings mix metric and imperial units. Understanding both is essential for maintenance.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 PSI equals approximately 6.89476 kilopascals.
methodology: 1 PSI ≈ 6.89476 kPa. To convert kPa to PSI, divide by 6.89476. For example, 100 kPa ≈ 14.5 PSI, 200 kPa ≈ 29 PSI.
Tire pressure specifications often use both kPa (common in metric countries) and PSI (common in imperial).
Equipment manuals may specify pressures in either unit depending on manufacturer origin.
This converter provides precise pressure conversions for maintenance and equipment specification.
examples: Example 1 – Tire pressure: 220 kPa equals approximately 32 PSI.
Example 2 – Compressor: A 700 kPa system pressure is approximately 102 PSI.
Example 3 – Hydraulic system: 5,000 kPa pressure is approximately 725 PSI.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Kilopascals to PSI?
faqs.answer: 1 PSI ≈ 6.89476 kPa. Divide kPa by 6.89476 to get PSI.

faqs.question: What is the correct tire pressure?
faqs.answer: Check vehicle door jamb or manual. Typical car tire: 200-240 kPa (29-35 PSI). Truck: 240-275 kPa (35-40 PSI).

faqs.question: How do I convert bar to kPa?

glossary.definition: Metric pressure unit equal to 1,000 pascals.
Pounds per Square Inch, imperial pressure unit.
